      • startGame

        public void startGame()
               throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                      javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                      javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                      javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                      java.io.IOException
        Starts the game of TicTacToe in response to the "Start" Button being pressed. It randomly determines a starting player and sends a message to both players to inform them of the starting player.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
        java.io.IOException

      • handleCommands

        public boolean handleCommands(java.lang.String msg,
                              boolean selfSentCommand)
                       throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                              java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                              javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                              javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                              javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                              java.io.IOException
        Checks if a given chat message contained a command. This also handles all of the TicTacToe game logic and determines if the game ended (either by someone winning or by a draw. Valid commands could be /set (followed by a field index), /resetgame or /startgame.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to parse
        selfSentCommand - If yourself sent the message
        Returns:
        If the message was a command
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
        java.io.IOException

      • resetTicTacToe

        public void resetTicTacToe()
        Handles reseting the game if both users agree to it. Both users must have pressed the "Reset" Button for this method to reset the game. It can then be restarted.
